jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Brain Co.

Brain Co. is an Applied AI startup founded by Elad Gil and Jared Kushner, and backed by many of Silicon Valley’s leading builders — including Patrick Collison (CEO of Stripe), Andrej Karpathy (Cofounder of OpenAI), Mike Krieger (CPO of Anthropic), Kevin Weil (CPO of OpenAI), and Aravind Srinivas (CEO of Perplexity).

We are building an AI platform and applications for the world’s most important institutions - delivering impact on real-world problems.

Our progress so far

  • Automated construction permitting for a sovereign government → 80% faster, unlocking $375M+ in value

  • Optimized supply chains for a leading global energy company → 30% lower cost, 99% reliability, preventing $100M+ in losses

  • Streamlined hospital patient care across national health systems → 40% better outcomes, 80% less admin work

  • Raised a $30M Series A from top investors

  • Built a team of 40+ AI experts from Tesla, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA, and Databricks

At Brain Co., your work will be deployed in the real world, not stuck in research. We move fast, with more demand than we can serve, and are looking for exceptional people to take ownership from day one.

About The Role

We’re looking for a Product Manager to join our growing Product team and take full ownership of a well-scoped product area from day one. You’ll translate business problems into PRDs, partner closely with engineering and design, and drive projects through build, launch, and iteration.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced, early-stage environments, can bring structure to ambiguity, and enjoys turning complex ideas into clear, executable plans. Success in this role will open the path to broader product ownership and leadership scope over time.

This role will be filled through a referral-only network approach. We are not accepting inbound applications.


In This Role, You Will:

  • Own a defined product area end-to-end — from discovery and scoping through design, development, and delivery

  • Write crisp PRDs and translate complex problems into actionable technical requirements

  • Collaborate with engineering, design, and operations to ship high-quality products quickly

  • Manage execution timelines, milestones, and dependencies to ensure on-time delivery

  • Establish clarity and alignment across teams in a fast-moving environment

  • Measure impact, gather feedback, and drive iteration to ensure continuous improvement

  • Help shape Brain Co.’s product development culture and best practices as the team scales

You Might Thrive In This Role If You:

  • Have product experience in tech-forward companies within insurance, finance, or legal domains

  • Bring early-stage or startup experience, thriving in high-ownership, low-structure environments

  • Have a track record of taking projects from concept or statement of work through launch

  • Communicate clearly across technical and business audiences

  • Are proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable managing multiple workstreams at once

  • Enjoy building process lightly but effectively to help teams move faster

  • Are motivated by seeing your work deployed and making real-world impact


Benefits

  • Competitive salary plus equity

  • Daily lunches

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401(k)

  • Medical, Dental, and Vision

  • Unlimited PTO


Why Join Us

  • Ship quickly, iterate constantly, and see your work deployed at global scale

  • Collaborate with industry veterans from Tesla, DeepMind, Databricks, and more

  • Accelerate your career with ownership based on impact, not tenure

  • Earn competitive compensation + meaningful equity in a high-growth company

  • Thrive in a culture built on speed, curiosity, and impact

jobs.title: AI/ML Engineer, Deployed
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Brain Co.

Brain Co. is an Applied AI startup founded by Elad Gil and Jared Kushner, and backed by many of Silicon Valley’s leading builders — including Patrick Collison (CEO of Stripe), Andrej Karpathy (Cofounder of OpenAI), Mike Krieger (CPO of Anthropic), Kevin Weil (CPO of OpenAI), and Aravind Srinivas (CEO of Perplexity).We are building an AI platform and applications for the world’s most important institutions - delivering impact on real-world problems.Our progress so far

  • Automated construction permitting for a sovereign government → 80% faster, unlocking $375M+ in value

  • Optimized supply chains for a leading global energy company → 30% lower cost, 99% reliability, preventing $100M+ in losses

  • Streamlined hospital patient care across national health systems → 40% better outcomes, 80% less admin work

  • Raised a $30M Series A from top investors

  • Built a team of 40+ AI experts from Tesla, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA, and Databricks

At Brain Co., your work will be deployed in the real world, not stuck in research. We move fast, with more demand than we can serve, and are looking for exceptional people to take ownership from day one.

About The Role

As an AI/ML Engineer at Brain Co., you will play a crucial role in deploying state-of-the-art models to automate various real world problems in sectors such as healthcare, government and energy. Part of the role will involve turning research breakthroughs into practical solutions for various nation states. This role is your opportunity to make a significant impact by making AI technology both accessible and influential.

In This Role, You Will:

  • Innovate and Deploy: Design and deploy advanced LLM models to tackle real-world problems, particularly in automating complex, manual processes in a range of real-world verticals.

  • Optimize and Scale: Build scalable data pipelines, optimize models for performance and accuracy, and prepare them for production. Monitor and maintain deployed models to ensure they continue delivering value across various governments worldwide.

  • Make a Difference: Engage in projects including but not limited to optimizing the world's most advanced energy production systems, modernizing core government workflows, or improving patient outcomes in advanced public healthcare systems. Your work will directly impact how AI benefits individuals, businesses, and society at large.

  • Engage with Leaders: interact directly with government officials in various countries and apply the first of its kind AI solutions while working alongside experienced ex. Founders, AI researchers, and software engineers to understand complex business challenges and deliver AI-powered solutions. Join a dynamic team where ideas are exchanged freely and creativity flourishes. You will be able to wear many hats: software building, product management, sales, interpersonal skills.

  • Learn and Lead: Keep abreast of the latest developments in machine learning and AI. Participate in code reviews, share knowledge, and set an example with high-quality engineering practices.

You Might Thrive In This Role If You:

  • Hold a BSc/Master’s/PhD degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.

  • Have experience building GenAI-focused applications with the latest technologies, including but not limited to Agents, reasoning models and RAG.

  • Have at least a high level familiarity with the architecture and operation of large language models.

  • Have personally implemented models in common ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Jax or TensorFlow.

  • Possess a strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.

  • Exhibit excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a proactive approach to challenges.

  • Can work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

  • Thrive in fast-paced environments where priorities or deadlines may compete.

  • Are eager to own problems end-to-end and willing to acquire any necessary knowledge to get the job done.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary plus equity

  • Daily lunches

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401(k)

  • Medical, Dental and Vision

  • Unlimited PTO

Why Join Us

  • Ship quickly, iterate constantly and see your work deployed at global scale

  • Collaborate with industry veterans from Tesla, DeepMind, Databricks, and more

  • Accelerate your career with ownership based on impact, not tenure

  • Earn competitive compensation + meaningful equity in a high-growth company

  • Thrive in a culture built on speed, curiosity, and impact

If you want to see your work deployed at scale with real impact, Brain Co. is the place to build.

This is a hybrid role based out of our Dubai office.

jobs.title: AI Product Engineer, Deployed
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Brain Co.

Brain Co. is an Applied AI startup founded by Elad Gil and Jared Kushner, and backed by many of Silicon Valley’s leading builders — including Patrick Collison (CEO of Stripe), Andrej Karpathy (Cofounder of OpenAI), Mike Krieger (CPO of Anthropic), Kevin Weil (CPO of OpenAI), and Aravind Srinivas (CEO of Perplexity).We are building an AI platform and applications for the world’s most important institutions - delivering impact on real-world problems.Our progress so far

  • Automated construction permitting for a sovereign government → 80% faster, unlocking $375M+ in value

  • Optimized supply chains for a leading global energy company → 30% lower cost, 99% reliability, preventing $100M+ in losses

  • Streamlined hospital patient care across national health systems → 40% better outcomes, 80% less admin work

  • Raised a $30M Series A from top investors

  • Built a team of 40+ AI experts from Tesla, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA, and Databricks

At Brain Co., your work will be deployed in the real world, not stuck in research. We move fast, with more demand than we can serve, and are looking for exceptional people to take ownership from day one.

About The Role

As an AI Product Engineer at Brain Co., you will play a pivotal role in building and deploying state-of-the-art software solutions to automate various real-world problems. You will work directly with the customer to develop the product spec and building from zero. From designing robust front-end interfaces to developing scalable back-end systems, you will turn research breakthroughs into practical solutions for various nation states. This role is your opportunity to make a significant impact by making AI technology both accessible and influential.

In This Role, You Will:

  • Innovate and Deploy: Design, develop, and deploy advanced software solutions that integrate AI to tackle real-world problems, particularly in automating complex, manual processes in government and industrial sectors. Utilize modern web frameworks, microservices architecture, and cloud computing to build applications that apply AI to intricate optimization challenges.

  • Make a Big Impact: Interact directly with key customer stakeholders to apply pioneering AI solutions while working alongside experienced ex-founders, government officials/ministers, AI researchers, and engineers. Understand complex business challenges and deliver software solutions powered by AI. Join a dynamic team where ideas are exchanged freely, and creativity flourishes. You will wear many hats: software development, product management, sales, and interpersonal skills.

  • Optimize and Scale: Build scalable data pipelines, integrate industrial sensor networks, optimize application performance and reliability, and prepare systems for production. Engage in projects including but not limited to optimizing the world's most advanced energy production systems, modernizing core government workflows, or improving patient outcomes in advanced public healthcare systems.

  • Learn and Lead: Stay abreast of the latest developments in software engineering and AI. Participate in code reviews, share knowledge, and set an example with high-quality engineering practices. Mentor junior engineers and lead by example.

  • Make a Difference: Monitor and maintain deployed applications to ensure they continue delivering value across various governments worldwide. Work directly with customer engineers and SMEs to develop and tune applications that optimize their workflows and deliver tangible upside. Your work will directly impact how AI benefits individuals, businesses, and society at large.

You Might Thrive In This Role If You:

  • Are eager to travel to customer locations globally for 6+ months and work directly with SMEs and end-users

  • Minimum 2+ years of experience and an appetite for working directly with the customer to develop the software spec and build from zero

  • Experience with front-end and back-end technologies, microservices, and cloud platforms

  • Experience with modern web tooling such as React, Typescript, RESTful APIs, and database management systems

  • Exhibit excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a proactive approach to challenges

  • Enjoys working collaboratively with cross-functional teams

  • Thrive in fast-paced environments where priorities or deadlines may compete.

  • Eager to own problems end-to-end and willing to acquire any necessary knowledge to get the job done

Nice to Have:

  • Experience working on on-site engineering projects or in client-facing roles (Forward-Deployed Engineer, Solutions Engineer, Integration Engineer, Sales Engineer, Customer Engineer)

  • Knowledge of Arabic or other regional languages is a plus.

  • Possess a strong foundation in software design principles, data structures, and algorithms

  • Hold a Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field

Benefits

  • Competitive salary plus equity

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401(k)

  • Medical, Dental and Vision

  • Unlimited PTO

Why Join Us

  • Ship quickly, iterate constantly and see your work deployed at global scale

  • Collaborate with industry veterans from Tesla, DeepMind, Databricks, and more

  • Accelerate your career with ownership based on impact, not tenure

  • Earn competitive compensation + meaningful equity in a high-growth company

  • Thrive in a culture built on speed, curiosity, and impact

If you want to see your work deployed at scale with real impact, Brain Co. is the place to build.

Brain Co. is an Applied AI startup founded by Elad Gil and Jared Kushner, and backed by many of Silicon Valley’s leading builders — including Patrick Collison (CEO of Stripe), Andrej Karpathy (Cofounder of OpenAI), Mike Krieger (CPO of Anthropic), Kevin Weil (CPO of OpenAI), and Aravind Srinivas (CEO of Perplexity).We are building an AI platform and applications for the world’s most important institutions - delivering impact on real-world problems.Our progress so far

  • Optimized supply chains for a leading global energy company → 30% lower cost, 99% reliability, preventing $100M+ in losses

  • Streamlined hospital patient care across national health systems → 40% better outcomes, 80% less admin work

  • Raised a $30M Series A from top investors

  • Built a team of 40+ AI experts from Tesla, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA, and Databricks

At Brain Co., your work will be deployed in the real world, not stuck in research. We move fast, with more demand than we can serve, and are looking for exceptional people to take ownership from day one.

About The Role

As an AI Platform Engineer at Brain Co., you will play a pivotal role in building and deploying state-of-the-art backend systems to automate various real-world problems. You will work directly with the customer to develop the product spec and building from zero. From designing robust and scalable architectures to optimizing performance and reliability, you will turn research breakthroughs into practical solutions for various nation states. This role is your opportunity to make a significant impact by making AI technology both accessible and influential.

In This Role, You Will:

  • Innovate and Deploy: Design, develop, and deploy advanced backend solutions that integrate AI to tackle real-world problems, particularly in automating complex, manual processes in government and industrial sectors. Utilize modern backend frameworks, microservices architecture, and cloud computing to build applications that apply AI to intricate optimization challenges.

  • Make a Big Impact: Interact directly with key customer stakeholders to apply pioneering AI solutions while working alongside experienced ex-founders, government officials/ministers, AI researchers, and engineers. Understand complex business challenges and deliver backend solutions powered by AI. Join a dynamic team where ideas are exchanged freely, and creativity flourishes. You will wear many hats: software development, system architecture, product management, and interpersonal skills.

  • Optimize and Scale: Build scalable data pipelines, integrate industrial sensor networks, optimize application performance and reliability, and prepare systems for production. Engage in projects including but not limited to optimizing the world's most advanced energy production systems, modernizing core government workflows, or improving patient outcomes in advanced public healthcare systems.

  • Learn and Lead: Stay abreast of the latest developments in backend engineering and AI. Participate in code reviews, share knowledge, and set an example with high-quality engineering practices. Mentor junior engineers and lead by example.

  • Make a Difference: Monitor and maintain deployed applications to ensure they continue delivering value across various governments worldwide. Work directly with customer engineers and SMEs to develop and tune applications that optimize their workflows and deliver tangible upside. Your work will directly impact how AI benefits individuals, businesses, and society at large.

You Might Thrive In This Role If You:

  • Have 5+ years of experience and an appetite for working directly with the customer to develop the software spec and build from zero

  • Are experienced with backend technologies, microservices, and cloud platforms.

  • Have demonstrated experience with modern backend frameworks, cloud compute and storage, RESTful APIs, and database management systems.

  • Possess a strong foundation in software design principles, data structures, and algorithms.

  • Exhibit excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a proactive approach to challenges.

  • Have deep experience in implementing security best practices across the platform — from system/network security, to code and deployment pipelines, monitoring, and incident response.

  • Can work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

  • Thrive in fast-paced environments where priorities or deadlines may compete.

  • Are eager to own problems end-to-end and willing to acquire any necessary knowledge to get the job done.

  • Hold a Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.

  • Daily lunches

  • Commuter benefits

  • Thrive in a culture built on speed, curiosity, and impact

 - Optimize and Scale: Build scalable data pipelines, integrate industrial sensor networks, optimize application performance and reliability, and prepare systems for production. Work directly with customer engineers and SMEs to develop and tune applications that optimize their workflows and deliver tangible upside. Your work will directly impact how AI benefits individuals, businesses, and society at large.

You Might Thrive In This Role If You:

 - Have 5+ years of experience and an appetite for working directly with the customer to develop the software spec and build from zero

 - Are experienced with backend technologies, microservices, and cloud platforms.

 - Have demonstrated experience with modern backend frameworks, cloud compute and storage, RESTful APIs, and database management systems.

 - Possess a strong foundation in software design principles, data structures, and algorithms.

 - Exhibit excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a proactive approach to challenges.

 - Have deep experience in implementing security best practices across the platform — from system/network security, to code and deployment pipelines, monitoring, and incident response.

 - Can work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

 - Thrive in fast-paced environments where priorities or deadlines may compete.

 - Are eager to own problems end-to-end and willing to acquire any necessary knowledge to get the job done.

 - Hold a Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.

Benefits

 - Competitive salary plus equity

 - Daily lunches

 - Commuter benefits

 - 401(k)

 - Medical, Dental and Vision

 - Unlimited PTO

Why Join Us

 - Collaborate with industry veterans from Tesla, DeepMind, Databricks, and more

 - Accelerate your career with ownership based on impact, not tenure

 - Earn competitive compensation + meaningful equity in a high-growth company

About The Role

As an AI/ML Engineer at Brain Co., you will play a crucial role in deploying state-of-the-art models to automate various real world problems in sectors such as healthcare, government and energy. Part of the role will involve turning research breakthroughs into practical solutions for various nation states. This role is your opportunity to make a significant impact by making AI technology both accessible and influential.

In This Role, You Will:

  • Innovate and Deploy: Design and deploy advanced LLM models to tackle real-world problems, particularly in automating complex, manual processes in a range of real-world verticals.

  • Optimize and Scale: Build scalable data pipelines, optimize models for performance and accuracy, and prepare them for production. Monitor and maintain deployed models to ensure they continue delivering value across various governments worldwide.

  • Make a Difference: Engage in projects including but not limited to optimizing the world's most advanced energy production systems, modernizing core government workflows, or improving patient outcomes in advanced public healthcare systems. Your work will directly impact how AI benefits individuals, businesses, and society at large.

  • Engage with Leaders: interact directly with government officials in various countries and apply the first of its kind AI solutions while working alongside experienced ex. Founders, AI researchers, and software engineers to understand complex business challenges and deliver AI-powered solutions. Join a dynamic team where ideas are exchanged freely and creativity flourishes. You will be able to wear many hats: software building, product management, sales, interpersonal skills.

  • Learn and Lead: Keep abreast of the latest developments in machine learning and AI. Participate in code reviews, share knowledge, and set an example with high-quality engineering practices.

You Might Thrive In This Role If You:

  • Hold a BSc/Master’s/PhD degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.

  • Have experience building GenAI-focused applications with the latest technologies, including but not limited to Agents, reasoning models and RAG.

  • Have at least a high level familiarity with the architecture and operation of large language models.

  • Have personally implemented models in common ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Jax or TensorFlow.

  • Possess a strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.

  • Exhibit excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a proactive approach to challenges.

  • Can work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

  • Thrive in fast-paced environments where priorities or deadlines may compete.

  • Are eager to own problems end-to-end and willing to acquire any necessary knowledge to get the job done.

Benefits

  • Daily lunches

  • Earn competitive compensation + meaningful equity in a high-growth company

  • Thrive in a culture built on speed, curiosity, and impact

If you want to see your work deployed at scale with real impact, Brain Co. is the place to build.

jobs.title: BizOps
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Brain Co.

Brain Co. is an Applied AI startup founded by Elad Gil and Jared Kushner, and backed by many of Silicon Valley’s leading builders — including Patrick Collison (CEO of Stripe), Andrej Karpathy (Cofounder of OpenAI), Mike Krieger (CPO of Anthropic), Kevin Weil (CPO of OpenAI), and Aravind Srinivas (CEO of Perplexity).

We are building an AI platform and applications for the world’s most important institutions - delivering impact on real-world problems.

Our progress so far

  • Automated construction permitting for a sovereign government → 80% faster, unlocking $375M+ in value

  • Optimized supply chains for a leading global energy company → 30% lower cost, 99% reliability, preventing $100M+ in losses

  • Streamlined hospital patient care across national health systems → 40% better outcomes, 80% less admin work

  • Raised a $30M Series A from top investors

  • Built a team of 40+ AI experts from Tesla, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA, and Databricks

At Brain Co., your work will be deployed in the real world, not stuck in research. We move fast, with more demand than we can serve, and are looking for exceptional people to take ownership from day one.

About the Role

We’re seeking a BizOps leader to join our growing team in San Francisco. This is a high-impact role at the intersection of strategy, operations, and execution — driving clarity, alignment, and scale across Brain Co.’s most important initiatives.

You’ll partner directly with the executive team and cross-functional leads to shape strategy, design and optimize business processes, and ensure flawless execution of company priorities. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in ambiguity, moves seamlessly between the boardroom and the trenches, and can bridge strategic vision with operational rigor.

Key Responsibilities

  • Drive Strategic Initiatives: Identify, scope, and lead mission-critical projects that define Brain Co.’s growth trajectory across product, go-to-market, and operations.

  • Support Executive Decision-Making: Partner with leadership on strategic planning, fundraising support, board materials, and investor communications.

  • Build Scalable Systems: Design and implement frameworks for operational excellence across functions including finance, GTM, hiring, and partnerships.

  • Operationalize Insights: Translate complex data and analysis into actionable recommendations, ensuring initiatives deliver measurable impact.

  • Cross-Functional Leadership: Act as connective tissue between product, engineering, GTM, and operations — driving alignment and accountability.

  • Execution at Speed: Lead from the front, ensuring projects are not only designed well but also executed to a high standard on aggressive timelines.

What We’re Looking For

Experience

  • 12–15+ years of professional experience.

  • Background in top-tier consulting (McKinsey, Bain, BCG) and/or investment banking / private equity.

  • Proven operating experience in high-growth startups; ability to scale systems and processes under pressure.

  • Demonstrated track record of owning and delivering cross-functional initiatives with material business impact.

Skills & Attributes

  • Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills; ability to distill complexity into clarity.

  • Executive-level communication and presence; able to influence senior stakeholders and external partners.

jobs.title: AI DD Principal
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Brain Co.

Brain Co. is an Applied AI startup founded by Elad Gil and Jared Kushner, and backed by many of Silicon Valley’s leading builders — including Patrick Collison (CEO of Stripe), Andrej Karpathy (Cofounder of OpenAI), Mike Krieger (CPO of Anthropic), Kevin Weil (CPO of OpenAI), and Aravind Srinivas (CEO of Perplexity).

Our progress so far

  • Automated construction permitting for a sovereign government → 80% faster, unlocking $375M+ in value

  • Optimized supply chains for a leading global energy company → 30% lower cost, 99% reliability, preventing $100M+ in losses

  • Streamlined hospital patient care across national health systems → 40% better outcomes, 80% less admin work

  • Raised a $30M Series A from top investors

  • Built a team of 40+ AI experts from Tesla, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA, and Databricks

At Brain Co., your work will be deployed in the real world, not stuck in research. We move fast, with more demand than we can serve, and are looking for exceptional people to take ownership from day one.

About the Role

We’re seeking an AI Due Diligence Principal to lead engagements with private equity sponsors and investors — evaluating assets through the lens of AI-driven opportunities. This role sits at the intersection of advanced AI technology, investment strategy, and value creation.

You will lead diligence processes end-to-end, serve as a trusted advisor to investors, and partner closely with Brain Co.’s engineering and product teams to deliver actionable recommendations and high-impact AI solutions for sponsor-backed companies. This role is designed for an operator who combines deep strategic experience with technical literacy, commercial instinct, and the ability to drive results in high-stakes environments.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead AI Diligence: Evaluate target companies’ AI strategies, data infrastructure, and technical maturity. Identify opportunities, risks, and areas for value creation, distilling findings into clear, business-oriented insights.

  • Sponsor & Client Management: Serve as the primary partner for private equity and corporate sponsors. Build long-term trust, align on scope, deliver findings with conviction, and ensure client satisfaction.

  • Bridge Strategy & Technology: Translate complex AI/ML capabilities into actionable recommendations for investment committees, portfolio executives, and Brain Co. stakeholders.

  • Deliver Value Creation Plans: Work with engineering and product leaders to scope, prioritize, and implement AI solutions within sponsor-backed assets — ensuring commercial outcomes and technical feasibility.

  • Drive Execution: Own diligence engagements from scoping through delivery, ensuring excellence in both strategic analysis and operational outcomes.

What We’re Looking For

Experience

  • 12–15+ years of professional experience.

  • Background in top-tier consulting PE groups (McKinsey, Bain, BCG) and/or direct private equity investing.

  • Startup operating experience required; demonstrated ability to execute and scale in high-growth environments.

  • Proven track record of leading complex diligence processes with material investment and operational outcomes.

Skills & Attributes

  • Strong technical literacy in AI/ML, with the ability to evaluate data pipelines, model strategies, and infrastructure at a high level.

  • Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills; ability to turn complex analyses into clear insights.

  • Executive-level communication; proven ability to influence senior sponsors, investors, and portfolio executives.

  • Low-ego, hands-on operator who thrives in ambiguous, fast-paced environments.

  • Commercial instinct and ownership mindset — capable of connecting AI opportunities directly to value creation.

  • Must be in SF or willing to relocate (hybrid 3 days/week in office)

Why Join Us

  • Shape how AI drives investment decisions across industries, working directly with leading sponsors and portfolio executives.

  • Be part of an applied AI company tackling some of the world’s most consequential challenges.

  • Collaborate with industry veterans and world-class investors.

  • Earn competitive compensation + meaningful equity.

  • Thrive in a culture built on speed, curiosity, and impact.

If you want to sit at the frontier of AI and private equity — and deliver tangible results at global scale — Brain Co. is the place to build.

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Brain Co.

Brain Co. is an Applied AI startup founded by Elad Gil and Jared Kushner, and backed by many of Silicon Valley’s leading builders — including Patrick Collison (CEO of Stripe), Andrej Karpathy (Cofounder of OpenAI), Mike Krieger (CPO of Anthropic), Kevin Weil (CPO of OpenAI), and Aravind Srinivas (CEO of Perplexity).

We are building an AI platform and applications for the world’s most important institutions - delivering impact on real-world problems.Our progress so far

  • Automated construction permitting for a sovereign government → 80% faster, unlocking $375M+ in value

  • Optimized supply chains for a leading global energy company → 30% lower cost, 99% reliability, preventing $100M+ in losses

  • Streamlined hospital patient care across national health systems → 40% better outcomes, 80% less admin work

  • Raised a $30M Series A from top investors

  • Built a team of 40+ AI experts from Tesla, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA, and Databricks

At Brain Co., your work will be deployed in the real world, not stuck in research. We move fast, with more demand than we can serve, and are looking for exceptional people to take ownership from day one.

About the Role

We’re seeking a Customer Success Manager to join our growing team in our San Francisco HQ. In this role, you'll work at the intersection of AI product delivery and customer engagement — helping define, shape, and drive AI-powered solutions that address mission-critical challenges in finance, energy, and government sectors.

You’ll collaborate closely with data scientists, engineers, and senior stakeholders to translate complex business needs into actionable technical solutions. As the voice of the customer, you’ll lead agile delivery cycles, ensure high-quality outcomes, and foster long-term relationships built on trust and impact.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define & Prioritize Features: Work with customers to identify high-impact problems and define AI-driven product features to address them.

  • Translate Business Needs: Convert customer requirements into clear technical specifications and use cases for internal teams.

  • Lead Agile Delivery: Oversee agile sprints and project timelines, ensuring timely and high-quality solution delivery.

  • Drive Adoption: Travel regionally to engage with users, onboard stakeholders, and gather direct product feedback for continuous improvement.

  • Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Serve as the bridge between customers and internal teams including data scientists, engineers, and product leads.

  • Act as Customer Champion: Build trusted relationships and ensure the long-term success of deployed solutions.

What We’re Looking For

  • Experience:

    • 3-5 years in customer success, product management, delivery consulting, or technical account management.

    • Experience at top-tier product or consulting organizations (e.g., Palantir, Google, Amazon, BCG, McKinsey, etc.)

  • Technical Fluency:

    • Strong understanding of AI/ML concepts, data workflows, and model deployment processes.

    • Ability to discuss and assess technical trade-offs with engineering teams.

  • Communication & Relationship Skills:

    • Proven ability to build rapport and trust with enterprise customers and senior stakeholders.

    • Excellent written and verbal communication, including the ability to simplify technical details for non-technical audiences.

  • Execution & Ownership:

    • Hands-on mindset with a bias for action and a strong sense of ownership.

    • Experience managing agile product or project delivery cycles.

  • Mobility:

    • Willingness to travel within the region to meet customers and oversee deployments on-site.

Why Join Us

  • Ship quickly, iterate constantly and see your work deployed at global scale

  • Collaborate with industry veterans from Tesla, DeepMind, Databricks, and more

  • Accelerate your career with ownership based on impact, not tenure

  • Earn competitive compensation + meaningful equity in a high-growth company

  • Thrive in a culture built on speed, curiosity, and impact

If you want to see your work deployed at scale with real impact, Brain Co. is the place to build.

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Brain Co.

Brain Co. is an Applied AI startup founded by Elad Gil and Jared Kushner, and backed by many of Silicon Valley’s leading builders — including Patrick Collison (CEO of Stripe), Andrej Karpathy (Cofounder of OpenAI), Mike Krieger (CPO of Anthropic), Kevin Weil (CPO of OpenAI), and Aravind Srinivas (CEO of Perplexity).

We are building an AI platform and applications for the world’s most important institutions - delivering impact on real-world problems.Our progress so far

  • Automated construction permitting for a sovereign government → 80% faster, unlocking $375M+ in value

  • Optimized supply chains for a leading global energy company → 30% lower cost, 99% reliability, preventing $100M+ in losses

  • Streamlined hospital patient care across national health systems → 40% better outcomes, 80% less admin work

  • Raised a $30M Series A from top investors

  • Built a team of 40+ AI experts from Tesla, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA, and Databricks

At Brain Co., your work will be deployed in the real world, not stuck in research. We move fast, with more demand than we can serve, and are looking for exceptional people to take ownership from day one.

About The Role

We are looking for a passionate and experienced Product Designer to join our core team as our second full-time designer. You will play a critical role in shaping both the visual and structural design of complex, AI-driven software products. Your contributions will directly influence the company’s trajectory and the success of our innovative product suite.

What You'll Do

  • Lead end-to-end design efforts, including UX research, interaction design, visual design, prototyping, and testing.

  • Experiment with new AI design tools like Lovable, v0, and more to define how Product Design’s function on product teams is changing.

  • Collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to understand user requirements and translate them into elegant, intuitive solutions.

  • Design sophisticated software experiences tailored for enterprise and governmental environments, prioritizing usability, scalability, and aesthetics.

  • Help establish and evolve the design system and guidelines to ensure consistency, quality, and efficiency across all products.

  • Advocate for the user, continuously seeking insights and data to iterate and refine our product experiences.

Qualifications

  • 10+ years of professional experience in software product design, with a strong portfolio demonstrating elegant solutions for complex enterprise software.

  • Proven experience designing visually appealing, workflow-oriented products that significantly improve user productivity.

  • Exceptional skills in design tools (Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.) and familiarity with prototyping tools (e.g., Rive, Framer).

  • Strong understanding of UX principles, design thinking, and accessibility standards.

  • Experience working collaboratively in fast-paced, agile, and multidisciplinary teams.

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate design decisions and rationale.

  • Prior experience in AI-driven or data-intensive software solutions is a significant plus.

Why Join Us

  • Ship quickly, iterate constantly and see your work deployed at global scale

  • Collaborate with industry veterans from Tesla, DeepMind, Databricks, and more

  • Accelerate your career with ownership based on impact, not tenure

  • Earn competitive compensation + meaningful equity in a high-growth company

  • Thrive in a culture built on speed, curiosity, and impact

If you want to see your work deployed at scale with real impact, Brain Co. is the place to build.

At Brain Co., we believe in transparent, data-driven compensation that attracts and retains top talent. Our compensation framework is built on market research from leading platforms including Pave and Carta, ensuring our offers are competitive and equitable across all roles. We regularly benchmark our compensation packages against technology companies to maintain our position as an employer of choice.

jobs.title: Technical Sourcer, Engineering
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Brain Co.

Brain Co. is an Applied AI startup founded by Elad Gil and Jared Kushner, and backed by many of Silicon Valley’s leading builders — including Patrick Collison (CEO of Stripe), Andrej Karpathy (Cofounder of OpenAI), Mike Krieger (CPO of Anthropic), Kevin Weil (CPO of OpenAI), and Aravind Srinivas (CEO of Perplexity).

We are building an AI platform and applications for the world’s most important institutions - delivering impact on real-world problems.Our progress so far

  • Automated construction permitting for a sovereign government → 80% faster, unlocking $375M+ in value

  • Optimized supply chains for a leading global energy company → 30% lower cost, 99% reliability, preventing $100M+ in losses

  • Streamlined hospital patient care across national health systems → 40% better outcomes, 80% less admin work

  • Raised a $30M Series A from top investors

  • Built a team of 40+ AI experts from Tesla, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA, and Databricks

At Brain Co., your work will be deployed in the real world, not stuck in research. We move fast, with more demand than we can serve, and are looking for exceptional people to take ownership from day one.

About the Role

We’re looking for a Technical Sourcer to help build the foundation of our engineering recruiting engine at Brain Co. You’ll partner directly with engineering leadership to identify, engage, and inspire world-class engineers to join our team. This isn’t a coordination role — you’ll own pipeline creation for some of the most competitive talent pools in the world (AI/ML, Product, Platform).

Your work will be critical to scaling Brain Co.’s engineering team, ensuring we can keep up with demand from Fortune 50 companies and government systems around the globe. You’ll be responsible for mapping talent markets, creating targeted outreach strategies, and building the kind of candidate experience that gets top engineers excited to work with us.

This is a rare opportunity to join a fast-scaling AI startup at Series A and directly shape the caliber of our technical team.

You Might Thrive in This Role If You:

  • Have 1–3+ years of sourcing experience (agency or in-house) with a focus on engineering or technical talent.

  • Are energized by the hunt — you love researching markets, finding hidden talent, and cracking into competitive pipelines.

  • Know how to write compelling outreach that gets responses from engineers drowning in recruiter messages.

  • Are highly organized and can juggle multiple searches without dropping details.

  • Care about candidate experience and see sourcing as the start of the relationship, not just a numbers game.

  • Thrive in ambiguity — you don’t wait for perfect direction, you iterate and figure it out.

  • Want to grow into a full-cycle recruiter role as Brain Co.’s team expands.

  • Believe in Brain Co.’s mission to bring applied AI into the real world and want to help us hire the people who will make that possible.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary

  • Daily lunches

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401(k)

  • Medical, Dental and Vision

  • Unlimited PTO

You’ll partner directly with engineering leadership to identify, engage, and inspire world-class engineers to join our team. This isn’t a coordination role — you’ll own pipeline creation for some of the most competitive talent pools in the world (AI/ML, Product, Platform).

Your work will be critical to scaling Brain Co.’s engineering team, ensuring we can keep up with demand from Fortune 50 companies and government systems around the globe. You’ll be responsible for mapping talent markets, creating targeted outreach strategies, and building the kind of candidate experience that gets top engineers excited to work with us.

This is a rare opportunity to join a fast-scaling AI startup at Series A and directly shape the caliber of our technical team.


YOU MIGHT THRIVE IN THIS ROLE IF YOU:

 - Have 1–3+ years of sourcing experience (agency or in-house) with a focus on engineering or technical talent.

 - Are energized by the hunt — you love researching markets, finding hidden talent, and cracking into competitive pipelines.

 - Know how to write compelling outreach that gets responses from engineers drowning in recruiter messages.

 - Are highly organized and can juggle multiple searches without dropping details.

 - Care about candidate experience and see sourcing as the start of the relationship, not just a numbers game.

 - Thrive in ambiguity — you don’t wait for perfect direction, you iterate and figure it out.

 - Want to grow into a full-cycle recruiter role as Brain Co.’s team expands.

 - Believe in Brain Co.’s mission to bring applied AI into the real world and want to help us hire the people who will make that possible.

Benefits

 - Competitive salary

 - Daily lunches

 - Commuter benefits

 - 401(k)

 - Medical, Dental and Vision

 - Unlimited PTO

jobs.title: Full Cycle Technical Recruiter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Brain Co.

Brain Co. is an Applied AI startup founded by Elad Gil and Jared Kushner, and backed by many of Silicon Valley’s leading builders — including Patrick Collison (CEO of Stripe), Andrej Karpathy (Cofounder of OpenAI), Mike Krieger (CPO of Anthropic), Kevin Weil (CPO of OpenAI), and Aravind Srinivas (CEO of Perplexity).

We are building an AI platform and applications for the world’s most important institutions - delivering impact on real-world problems.Our progress so far

  • Automated construction permitting for a sovereign government → 80% faster, unlocking $375M+ in value

  • Optimized supply chains for a leading global energy company → 30% lower cost, 99% reliability, preventing $100M+ in losses

  • Streamlined hospital patient care across national health systems → 40% better outcomes, 80% less admin work

  • Raised a $30M Series A from top investors

  • Built a team of 40+ AI experts from Tesla, Google DeepMind, NVIDIA, and Databricks

At Brain Co., your work will be deployed in the real world, not stuck in research. We move fast, with more demand than we can serve, and are looking for exceptional people to take ownership from day one.

About the Role

We’re looking for a Full Cycle Technical Recruiter to own end-to-end hiring for Brain Co.’s Engineering teams (AI/ML, AI Product, AI Platform). You’ll partner closely with our in-house recruiting team and engineering leadership, including our Head of Engineering, to attract and close world-class technical talent — the kind of people who define the next decade of applied AI.

This isn’t a “req-filler” role. You’ll design and drive our recruiting engine — from crafting outbound strategies and refining our brand narrative to managing candidate experience and closing complex offers across global markets.

You’ll be joining a high-trust, high-velocity environment where recruiting is seen as a strategic advantage — and your work will directly shape the caliber and trajectory of Brain Co.’s technical team.

You’ll Own

  • Full-cycle recruiting across AI/ML, AI Product, and AI Platform roles — from sourcing to offer close

  • Partnering with leadership to define hiring needs and interview processes

  • Driving candidate experience that reflects our speed, precision, and mission-driven culture

  • Building market maps and data-driven sourcing strategies across competitive AI talent pools

  • Negotiating complex offers and compensation packages in collaboration with execs and finance

  • Serving as an ambassador for Brain Co.’s brand at events, conferences, and online communities

You Might Thrive in This Role If You:

  • Have 3–6+ years of full-cycle recruiting experience (agency or in-house, early stage experience)

  • Must have experience with engineering or technical roles

  • Have successfully hired AI/ML Engineers, Product Engineers, or Platform/Infra Engineers

  • Are a strong storyteller who can translate technical work into a compelling narrative for candidates

  • Are metrics-driven and know how to build pipelines that convert

  • Excel in high-autonomy, fast-moving environments where recruiting = impact

  • See recruiting as both art and strategy — relationship-driven, data-informed, and deeply collaborative

  • Believe in Brain Co.’s mission to bring applied AI into the real world

Benefits

  • Competitive salary

  • Daily lunches

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401(k)

  • Medical, Dental and Vision

  • Unlimited PTO
